reviewText: My boys love this DVD set - I mean four discs full of Thomas adventures, what's not to love!  It is also the new CGI animation so it is more bright and colorful than the old traditional Thomas.  Each DVD is a good length and all full of rip-roaring action!  My boys love Thomas & Friends and this set so far is their favorite.  I love that you can get four DVDs for around $20!  Very fun and of course full of great Thomas lessons!

reviewText: To be clear, this is a repackage of four earlier DVDs, making up the whole of Thomas' twelfth season:Railway Friends,High Speed Adventures,Team Up With Thomas,Percy and the BandstandWhat makes this season unique is the introduction of CGI effects to Thomas' world. People like Sir Topham Hatt are now animated, and each character's face is as well. The big benefit is that it creates more immersion in the setting: while the photography isn't as dynamic as it was in the early years of the show, the fact that the characters seem in action even when they're still makes the pacing seem a lot less slow than other recent episodes.There are some drawbacks, though. Often the CGI faces fail to capture the likeness of the old molded rubber faces, which becomes distracting to those who've watched the show for years. Further, it just seems odd to have lip sync when there's only one actor (the narrator), but the recent all-CGI episodes have a larger voice cast.The quality of the stories themselves is a mixed bag. On the one hand viewers quickly grow used to plot formulas of characters refusing help or behaving recklessly to get a job done. On the other hand, there is some innovation to be appreciated. This season rounds up just about all of the show's many characters, even for brief appearances, and occasionally characters who were once introduced with little purpose (Rosie the tank engine) play larger roles, making them more welcome alongside the old favorites.The model work reaches a high point, too, in this season, capturing the scale of sets better than ever before. There are some good group shots at the big station, and there's the great, industrial-looking yard, with multiple elevations and tall warehouses all around.All that's left is the presentation of the discs. While shot in HD widescreen, these are cropped to 4:3, leaving a lot of the picture lost. Also, for some reason there's a harsh yellow tint over everything, like the camera's color balance was off or something.I recommend these episodes over some of the more recent discs. The all-CGI stories look decent, but more often than not resort to cookie-cutter stories. This particular set is a good value, too - about half the price they would all be individually. If you know a Thomas fan, this is a good bet for them.

reviewText: Thomas & Friends Adventure Pack is a four-DVD set containing one full season of computer-animated episodes of the popular children's television show "Thomas & Friends", starring Thomas the anthropomorphic tank engine and his vehicle friends. Colorful adventures with character-building social morals distinguish this family-friendly collection. The four DVDs are "Railway Friends", "High Speed Adventures", "Team Up with Thomas", and "Percy and the Bandstand"; bonus features include songs, bonus episodes, read-along sections, and simple DVD games. Thomas & Friends Adventure Pack is a treat for children and for library children's DVD collections. 4 DVDs, 178 minutes.
summary: A treat for children and for library children's DVD collections

Also known as the American version of the complete 8th season of Thomas. Like the adventure pack, it'll save the customers money.
